organizations: National Music Writer News Corp Australia Network Ellie Goulding
title: Goulding reveals the GF ‘live’ truth
text:
Ellie Goulding shakes off AFL gig backlash as she reveals her running days are over until she has heart checks Kathy McCabe National Music Writer News Corp Australia Network Ellie Goulding shakes off AFL gig backlash as she reveals her running days are over until she has heart checks Kathy McCabe National Music Writer News Corp Australia Network Ellie Goulding at the AFL Grand Final 0:44 
Ellie Goulding performs Love Me Like You Do at the 2015 AFL Grand Final. Courtesy Channel Seven October 3rd 2015 2 days ago /video/video.news.com.au/Entertainment/ 
ACCLAIMED British chart-topper Ellie Goulding has laughed off her brush with the AFL entertainment curse, preferring technical glitches to being a “perfect pop star”. 
Goulding copped criticism and accusations of miming during her pre-game performance on Saturday. 
The 28-year-old singer, who is widely praised for nailing high notes out of the reach of mere mortals, jokes that she is an abject failure as a mime artist. 
As explained by her Australian promoter Michael Gudinski, a sound technician pressed play on the backing tracks for both of her hits Love Me Like You Do and Burn instead of one at a time. 
“I would rather something go wrong than go up there and people think I am this perfect pop star who everything goes right for, and I’m not human, I’m a robot,” she said. 
Goulding, who rocked out with her band during a concert at the Enmore Theatre on Sunday night, said she had no choice but to sing live to the backing track. Other Stories
